title: Blood Drive
description: Michael holds a lonely hearts party on Valentine's Day at the office, hoping that he will run into a woman he met earlier that day at a blood drive. Meanwhile, Jim and Pam have an awkward lunch with Phillis and Bob Vance.

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Yes, I'm from Techstar about a new phone system for you.   I was wondering if I could talk to Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry, he's not in right now.

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Really? He's never around when I come by.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They have new phone systems now that can ring directly to a salesman, or someone presses star and they go to accounting, basically 95% of my job.  But I'd like to see a machine that puts out candy for everyone. [realizing] Vending machine.

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: How about I make an appointment to come back?  That way, I know he'll be here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [while leafing through Michael's appointment book and seeing nothing but free time] Um, oh boy, let's see, he's really...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [approaching Reception] Michael Scott, manager.  Hi, how are ya?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There he is!

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Oh, hi! Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice to meet you, yeah.  Whew!  I can assure you we don't need a new system though.  Happy with ours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [coming out from his office] Hello, may I help you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jimbo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [impersonating Fonzie]  Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [running from his desk] Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: {Jim}, {Pam}, {Michael} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Phone Salesman
quotes.text: Ok.  I'm, uh, I'll be going.

quotes.speaker: {Jim}, {Pam}, {Michael} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] What was that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That was funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was funny.  Let's go do it to somebody else.   Ayyyy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, look at that.  Cupids and hearts. Really shoving our faces in it this year.  You doin OK, bud?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I miss Stacy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I hear ya.   It's been four months since I was with Holly, and she was way hotter then Stacy.  So if you think you're hurting...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can't even imagine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is our first and only Valentine's Day as fiances.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're only engaged once.  Well present company excluded, but.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, Jim?  On Cupid's birthday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  [Jim leans in for a kiss but Pam turns away]  She's fine.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, I received my first Valentine from a secret admirer.  [Kelly opens the envelope] Roses are red, violets are blue, it's time for your dental cleaning, and maybe a check-up too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow look at those.  How nice for you.  Up there, front and center, beautiful.  I think they would look better right here.  [Michael takes the flowers from Pam's desk and puts them on the ground off to the side]  They're very pretty and I wouldn't want them to fall.  [Kevin groans]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just about everyone in this office is single right now.   Including me.  And everyone is experiencing an incredible amount of emotional pain.  Especially me, because of my great capacity for emotion, and it is my first Valentine's Day since Holly, so I think that I am well qualified to understand that these people need to be protected from having love shoved into their faces.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, really, they're back?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't see them when they're on the floor

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: They're for her to look at, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I have a word with you, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, let's have a word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, um, Jim.  Today is a very difficult day for a lot of people in this office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  And the sexy looks between you and Pam, the general sexiness, the flowers, it's creating a bit of a hostile work environment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I understand that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So sexy it becomes hostile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I actually thought we were keeping it pretty low-key.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you guys insist on having your own private little love fest-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: -that none of us can be a part of-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can't be a part of our relationship, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gesturing Pam to be quiet] -then, we, are gonna have our own private Valentine's Day party.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That sounds fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So suck it.   Hey everybody, I just invited Jim to suck it, and I am cordially inviting all of you to a special convention, a lonely heart's convention, this afternoon. Singles only.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, deal with it Pam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So we may not have someone in our lives that we love, but we do have each other.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Having trouble finding a vein?

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: Yup, a little.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How about now? [Dwight untenses his arm]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I train my major blood vessels to retract into my body on command.  Also, I can retract my penis up into itself. [pauses, then nods signaling that he performed the feat]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am about to give blood.  The gift of everlasting life, the transfer of my bodily fluids, oh wow, that's a big needle, that --

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: You're gonna need to lie down right over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  Hello.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Hi, I cant talk right now.  I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Whew, I'm really nervous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Yeah, when I get nervous I sort of clam up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well, that's fine.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Whew, it's better for me just to be quiet, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, can I point something out to you?

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're actually talking a lot.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Sorry, it's the other thing I do when I get really nervous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: Alright, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God. [Michael clears his throat]

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: Just relax.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup, I'm good, whew.  Wow, I feel like a human juicebox. [Blood Girl laughs] Hawaiian blood punch.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Oh, that's gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Type O-Ocean Spray.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: God, stop.  Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, why don't you guys come have lunch with Bob and me?  We'll take all afternoon. [whispering] Michael is terrified of bob.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have a lot of work to do this afternoon.  Those mines aren't gonna sweep themselves.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yick.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I looked at the bag.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Ew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I looked straight at the bag.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: That's not good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could you distract me for a second, just talk about things that don't have blood in them?

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Well, ok... bags! [Michael is taken aback] Alright, that was bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was mean.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Um, a hat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A hat.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: A hat with no blood in it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is full of soup.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: You're cute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: You're done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, already.

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Ah, we did it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whew, wow I was so nervous about this I don't think I ate for three days. [Michael passes out]

quotes.speaker: Blood Girl
quotes.text: Is he OK?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [ccming to] Oh my God, how long was I out?  [Michael looks over where Blood Girl was and sees Hank]

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, waitress, where did the lady go?

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: Oh.  She left.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.  Oh, wait a second, wait a second, that's hers.   This is hers, she left her glove.  I need her name if I'm gonna return her glove.

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: I'm sorry sir we can't give out that information. [Michael sighs]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [seeing Kelly tear a paper heart in half] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Decorating.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'll help. [Meredith tears the wings off of a Cupid]  Now it's just a stupid baby.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It is so nice to go out with another couple.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Anything to get out of that office.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I know

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: I honestly don't know how you can work with that jackass, that other jackass, and that new jackass.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He's talking about Michael, Dwight, and Andy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah, I understood.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well here we all are.  Alone but together.  No flowers for us. [in a Mexican accent] Relationships, we don't need no stinking relationships.   I think we should all go around and tell our worst relationship story, and then get past it, just blow through it, yeah? Kelly, what about Ryan?  He treated you pretty terribly, yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, his heart was in the right place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but now his heart is in Thailand along with the rest of his body having random sex. [Kelly looks hurt]  Okay, sorry, let's, who else?  Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, I'm sure there's something you need to get off your chest.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you wanna just, anything? Are you sure?  I'm sure whatever you did it wasn't your fault.  OK well, who else?

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Everyone here who's bowled a 280 please raise your hand. [Bob does so]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way, a 280?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow,  that's impressive.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay. Now everyone here who's bowled under 70 raise their hand.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Bob.  Raise your hand. [Bob does so reluctantly]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.  Bob, no. No!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: One time. You love bringing up that one time, don't you?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes I do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim uses a 6 pound ball.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is a lie, that is a lie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, he bowled 5 frames with this pink sparkly thing until a little girl had to ask for her ball back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But! That girl must've had monstrous hands because the holes fit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, you just have little dainty fingers.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Oh yeah.  You can always model ladies' jewelry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nobody asked, Bob!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Do you risk telling him how you feel?  Do you say something that you can barely admit to yourself?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh God, what did you do?  I mean, not that I approve of any of it but...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was stupid, I told him.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Was he in to you in like a gay way?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Moron, if he was there wouldn't be a story.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He told me he wasn't gay. [everyone groans]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really sad.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm not done yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: A week later a friend of mine calls me up, and he says "I just saw him in a gay bar in Kansas City." [everybody groans except for Michael who looks pleasantly surprised]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well then it's a happy ending, because he was gay. You should call him!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My worst breakup was actually two breakups.  Two different men. I was in love with both of them and when things went bad they had a duel over me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, Dwight and Andy.  We were here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, this was years ago when I was living in Ohio.   John Mark and John David.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, you had two sets of different men actually duel over you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I guess I have.  Huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright who's next?  Where's Andy?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's on one of his honeymoons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He made non-refundable deposits on his honeymoons, so he's just knocking them off one at a time.  I think today he's hot air ballooning and later he's got a couple's massage.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My worst breakup was with Stacy.  It was a Sunday morning, we were reading the paper, and I said "Oh my God, I think the Eagles could clinch the NFC East!" and she said that we're done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what guys? I don't think we need to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're right.  OK everyone,  back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no.  I mean have this kind of party. I look around and I see all these beautiful people who are alone on Valentine's, and I think that there are other single people out there too.  We just need to find them.  There's a girl out there for all of us maybe even in this office park.  There has to be a way to get all these lonely people together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A net? a giant net?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  Not a giant net.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What do you have in mind?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was thinking maybe like a mixer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh God, that's a terrible idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Old fashioned meet market --

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: -- I don't think it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lonely people mixing with one another?  Breeding? Creating an even lonelier generation?  Ha, you're not allowing natural selection to do its work.  Pssh.  You're like the guy who invented the seat belt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These people need love and I am going to get it for them  Who cares if we sell a little bit less paper today?  A great boss cares more about the happiness of his employees then anything else.  I am going to be cupid, and I am going to shoot my sparrow at unsuspecting victims, and they are going to get hit and say "I'm in love I was hit by cupid's sparrow."  Funny little bird, but he gets the job done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.  No movement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, still early.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eh, its not that early.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] So how you holding up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm ok.  Feel a little lopsided because of all the blood they took out of my right side.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  No, I meant about being single today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.  Meh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meh, exactly.  Eh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. [two women, a blonde and a redhead, enter the office.  Michael and Dwight walk towards them and Dwight extends his hand to the redhead]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight K. Schrute. Why don't you introduce me to your little friend? [Dwight immediately breaks the handshake with the redhead and turns to the blonde]  Hi, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Babe alert! [to the redhead]  Hello, I'm Michael Scott, welcome to our little shindig.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: Oh, hi! I'm Lynn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lynn, follow me, come on in.  For you we have one of our top people Kevin Malone.  Kevin, come out here show your beautiful self.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [after a short pause] So run with the ball! Run with it, Kev.  [after another pause] Where you from?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm from here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, OK.  Well, he only gets better.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can untie any knot.  I'm serious.  Name a knot, any knot.  Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: I- I- believe you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You shouldn't believe everything you hear.  In fact, there are many knots that I cannot untie.  So where does a woman as charming as yourself find herself employed on a day such as today.

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: Um, I work at a place that does catalogs for community colleges and small businesses.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You must use a lot of paper.

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: Oh God tons of it .

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's the rule about eating when people are in the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think if you ordered hot food you're allowed to eat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, damn. [Pam looks down at her salad] They've been in there for like ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look at that.  Bob ordered hot food.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.  And I think they gave him too many fries.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We should help him out. [Jim and Pam each take a French fry, eat it, and then look toward the bathroom]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: At the Circle Drive-In they show old movies.  It's really cool.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: That does sound cool.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I used to go there with my fiance [Lynn is taken aback]. Before she left me [Lynn shows pity].   No, I mean, before I left her [Lynn looks confused].  She left me.   [Kevin walks away dejected]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think I blew it.  It all happened so fast.   So... fast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, Eric.  You mentioned before that you are in tool and dye repair.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith recently had a total hysterectomy, so that's sort of a repair.  Alright, I'll let you guys talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's going very well.  People are mixing, a lot of hope.  Cause that's what you hate to see, when hope gets crushed. [Michael suddenly turns to look at the open entrance door] Sorry, thought I heard somebody coming in.  Um, so [looking at his watch] it's not too late.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...and the kind of discounts we're talking about are not... hold on - Michael, Why do you keep looking at the front door?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No reason.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is somebody after you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why do you always go to that?  Has anyone ever been after anyone in this office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, it just takes one!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody's after me, I just, I met a woman when I was giving blood and I thought she might come by.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You met a woman when you were giving blood?  That is so romantic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not a big deal really, I just, you know met somebody, we hardly talked, I picked up her glove so I was hoping I could give it back to her.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, that makes it even more romantic.  This is like a modern day Enchanted, it's like a fairy tale.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: She could be your soul mate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, not likely.  3 billion woman on the planet, most of them live in Asia so the numbers just don't add up.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's possible.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She could be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Believe me its nothing.  I hardly even talked to her we just, we were lying there next to each other, I think our blood bags touched.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Aww. [Michael grins sheepishly]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here they come.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking up from her pilfering of Bob's food] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, just kidding.  Seriously though, that's enough.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you should cover it with the broccoli.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh great, I have to cover?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think they dined and dashed?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well they didn't dine so, yeah, maybe they just dashed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I thought we were having a nice time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We were.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [emerging from the Men's room] Empty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [exiting the Ladies' room] Mine too. [Pam and Jim notice the Handicapped stall and walk towards it.  Putting their ears to the door they hear Mr. and Mrs. Vance being intimate]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Is this the party? [everyone turns to Michael wanting to know if this is Blood Girl]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nah. [everyone groans and Girl turns around and walks away.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: OK then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Where were we?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [out of breath] Bowling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep, that, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: You didn't eat much there Jimbo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh initially I did.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Want some meat?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh sure, a little piece.  Ooh, no mushroom though.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Forgot.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, thank you. [As Phyllis enjoys Bob's meat, Jim and Pam look knowingly into the camera]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, I'm sorry we did not have a chance to talk more.  I get very nervous talking to pretty girls.  Seriously, feel how sweaty my hand is.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: That's really sweaty.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you on email?

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. [gives Kevin her card]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: Bye, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Good Valentine's.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So basically, the greater volume you decide to buy in, the greater discount we can give you.

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: OK. [Blonde stands up to leave]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: Look, I'm gonna go...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh-oh-oh before you go, I'd just love to get a firm commitment on this.  You know maybe sign-

quotes.speaker: Blonde Girl
quotes.text: Look, we already have a paper supplier.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK.  Well, thanks for wasting my time tonight, idiot.  God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you don't deserve her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, if anybody wants to go...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We can stay a little longer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? [everybody signifies their agreement, and Kelly gives Michael a piece of cake]  Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Michael, it's time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, you guys, you guys can get out I'm gonna soldier on a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come on, we'll all go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [after some encouragement] OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Four months ago, I dated a woman named Holly and, um, this is actually the first time that I've even considered getting back into that arena again.  You know what, sometimes it's not about whether Cinderella gets her slipper back, but it's about the fact that the prince even picked up the slipper at all.   There's a lot of princesses out there.  You know, they have all different sizes and shapes of feet and hands so I think, I think my odds are pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Pardon me, may I have a chocolate chip cookie?  I gave blood earlier and I'm still feeling woozy.

quotes.speaker: Blood Drive Worker
quotes.text: Of course. [noticing Stanley's arm] That's weird.  You got a cotton ball and tape and we've been using Band-Aids.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [backing out of the bloodmobile] I, uh-oh I feel so woozy I just [to Phyllis] Band-Aids.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Damn.
